Solar panel leasing program: Offer a leasing program where homeowners can rent solar panels instead of purchasing them outright. This would make the initial cost of installing solar panels more affordable, and the homeowner would only pay a monthly fee for the use of the panels. Confidence score: 0.8

Solar panel sharing platform: Create a platform that allows homeowners to share their excess solar energy with their neighbors. Homeowners could earn money by sharing their energy, and neighbors could benefit from cheaper energy bills. Confidence score: 0.9

Solar panel rent-to-own program: Offer a rent-to-own program where homeowners can rent solar panels for a set period of time (e.g., 5 years) and then have the option to purchase the panels at a discounted price. This would allow homeowners to test out solar panels without making a large upfront investment. Confidence score: 0.8

Solar panel-powered community centers: Install solar panels on community centers in the city, providing a central location for residents to charge their electric vehicles and power their devices. The community centers could also serve as hubs for education and outreach programs related to renewable energy. Confidence score: 0.9

Solar panel-powered public transportation: Install solar panels on public transportation vehicles (e.g., buses, trains) to provide a clean and sustainable source of energy for transportation. This could help reduce the city's carbon footprint and improve air quality. Confidence score: 0.9
